intro: Anthochlamys turcomanica, commonly known as the Turkmenian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has hairy leaves and stems, which help reduce water loss. Anthochlamys turcomanica is often found in mountainous regions and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
